metadata.title: CVE-2016-10156 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw in systemd v228 in /src/basic/fs-util.c caused world writable suidfiles to be created when using the systemd timers features, allowing localattackers to escalate their privileges to root. This is fixed in v229.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu16
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu16
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu16
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu16
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu16
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu16
systemd - 229-4ubuntu16
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu16
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu16
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu16
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu16
udev - 229-4ubuntu16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu16').
